intro: Anaphalis rhododactyla, commonly known as the pink cloud plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its woolly, silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower heads that resemble clouds, hence its common name. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Anaphalis rhododactyla is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
